bestOptimizationTechniques.name: Bayesian optimization (expected improvement)
bestOptimizationTechniques.summary: Model the objective surface and pick trials that maximize expected improvement over the best result.
bestOptimizationTechniques.whyItHelps: Improves sample efficiency versus uniform random search when trials are expensive or noisy.

bestOptimizationTechniques.name: Successive halving / ASHA
bestOptimizationTechniques.summary: Run many cheap partial trainings, pruning low performers early while allocating budget to promising candidates.
bestOptimizationTechniques.whyItHelps: Cuts wasted computation on weak trials and converges faster to strong configurations.

bestOptimizationTechniques.name: Sobol / Latin hypercube seeding
bestOptimizationTechniques.summary: Start the search with low-discrepancy samples that cover the space more uniformly than pure random draws.
bestOptimizationTechniques.whyItHelps: Reduces blind spots and gives later exploitation steps better anchor points.

bestOptimizationTechniques.name: Walk-forward / blocked cross-validation
bestOptimizationTechniques.summary: Score candidates across rolling, non-overlapping time blocks to avoid leakage and stress-test stability.
bestOptimizationTechniques.whyItHelps: Rewards configurations that generalize across regimes instead of overfitting a single window.

bestOptimizationTechniques.name: Ensemble the top performers
bestOptimizationTechniques.summary: Blend the strongest, diverse configurations into a composite strategy instead of picking a single winner.
bestOptimizationTechniques.whyItHelps: Smooths variance and reduces the risk of relying on one brittle optimum.
